pullrequest.title: Logging Part 3: Getting all messages from a log file

content.raw:
I added documentation instead of changing the constructor to copy data in 6a952fb06639.

This constructor is used by `MsgIter`. The pointers are for data are held by SQLite3, are borrowed, and are only valid until the `MsgIter` is stepped to the next result. This is handy for a user that queried all messages from one topic. Since they're all the same type and topic name the user will never call `Topic()` or `Type()`. Not including them in the constructor saves those copies from being made.

`MsgIter` returns a const reference to a `Message` which combined with the lack of copy and move constructors prevents a user from holding onto these pointers. In c3117e4b9a0a the copy and move constructors are explicitly deleted with documentation instead of implicitly deleted.
content.html:
I added documentation instead of changing the constructor to copy data in 6a952fb06639.

This constructor is used by MsgIter. The pointers are for data are held by SQLite3, are borrowed, and are only valid until the MsgIter is stepped to the next result. This is handy for a user that queried all messages from one topic. Since they're all the same type and topic name the user will never call Topic() or Type(). Not including them in the constructor saves those copies from being made.

MsgIter returns a const reference to a Message which combined with the lack of copy and move constructors prevents a user from holding onto these pointers. In c3117e4b9a0a the copy and move constructors are explicitly deleted with documentation instead of implicitly deleted.
